Presentation.n: As we all know, technology is becoming incredibly common in our increasingly tech-aware world. Those computers, whether big or small, helps companies like yours, simplify the lives of your employees and simplify tasks. But an important point often ignored by firms is the environmental impact of these computers. Using 100 computers switched on 27/7 for a year produces 69,205.8 kg of CO2 per year. Half of the French businesses that have participated in the following survey did not have sufficient information to complete it in its entirety.  It would take 12 hectares of woodlands to absorb this amount of carbon dioxide. Measuring the environmental footprint of your enterprise is an essential task for building a better tomorrow for our world and your firm. That is why we thank you for answering this survey.

Conclusion.n: Thank you for participating in our survey. Green IT offers lots of actions with different levels of difficulties, different economic objectives, and different scopes. You can inspire your employees to practice ecological gestures, optimize the already existing hardware/software to be more eco-friendly or completely change your projects patterns from the ground up to respect the earth. The respondents for this survey increased since 2015, which shows an ever-growing interest in Green IT. Once again we thank you for making Green IT a priority.
